metadata.feature_description: Handles and reports crawler-specific exceptions and errors.

steps.action: Navigated to Settings > Servers > Logs tab
steps.expected: The Logs tab should be accessible and display server logs
steps.actual: Successfully accessed the Logs tab which displays a list of server log files with Type, Name, Last Modified Date, and Size columns

steps.action: Clicked on the most recent log file (2026.01.09.log.resources)
steps.expected: Log file contents should be displayed showing logged exceptions
steps.actual: Log viewer opened showing exception entries with full stack traces including System.Net.WebException and System.UnauthorizedAccessException

steps.action: Reviewed log entries for exception details
steps.expected: Exceptions should be logged with timestamps, error types, and stack traces
steps.actual: Log entries show [ERROR] tags with timestamps (e.g., 2026-01-09 07:18:28.965), exception types (DotNetNuke.Services.Exceptions.Exceptions), and full stack traces

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Search Crawler Exception Classes Exist

steps.action: Reviewed SearchCrawlerException.cs, DirectoryIncludedException.cs, and DirectoryExcludedException.cs source files
steps.expected: Exception classes should be properly defined with appropriate inheritance and localized messages
steps.actual: SearchCrawlerException extends System.Exception. DirectoryIncludedException and DirectoryExcludedException both extend SearchCrawlerException with constructor accepting folderPath and providing localized error messages via LocalizationHelper.GetString()

observations: The SearchCrawler exception classes (SearchCrawlerException, DirectoryIncludedException, DirectoryExcludedException) are internal code constructs that are thrown during crawling operations when directory-related errors occur.

No SearchCrawler-specific exceptions were found in the current logs, which is expected as these exceptions only occur when the crawler encounters directory inclusion/exclusion errors during actual crawling operations.
The DNN logging infrastructure (DBLoggingProvider) is functional and properly logs all exceptions with timestamps, error types, and full stack traces.
The exception classes use LocalizationHelper for internationalized error messages, supporting multiple languages.
